photo.description: The Castillo de San Marcos is unique in North American architecture. As the only extant 17th century military construction in the country and the oldest masonry fortress in the United States it is a prime example of the &quot;bastion system&quot; of fortification, the culmination of hundreds of years of military defense engineering. It is also unique for the material used in its construction. The Castillo is one of only two fortifications in the world built out of a semi-rare form of limestone called coquina (The other is Fort Matanzas National Monument 14 miles south)
photo.tags: usa florida fl staugustine 2012 castillodesanmarcos saintaugustine
photo.title: Saint Augustine, Florida -- Castillo de San Marcos

photo.description: The only 17th Century Fortress in the United States, Castillo de San Marcos was built by the Spanish in the bastion system, which was very popular at the time. It's Star Fort design made it easily defendable. Today, it is a National Monument
photo.tags: history florida fort fortress staugustine castillodesanmarcos
photo.title: Castillo de San Marcos ... St. Augustine, Florida

photo.description: The Monument site consists of 20.5 acres and includes a reconstructed section of the walled defense line surrounding the city of St. Augustine incorporating the original city gate. The Castillo de San Marcos' architecture and detail are distinctive and unique. It is the oldest masonry and only extant 17th century fort in North America. As such it is an excellent example of the &quot;bastion system&quot; of fortification.
photo.tags: usa lighthouse florida fl staugustine 2012 saintaugustine castillodesanmarco
photo.title: Castillo de San Marcos - St. Augustine, Florida

photo.description: The 300 years of the colonial era (c. 1500-1800) were ones of constant warfare. As European countries vied with each other for the economic wealth in the “New Worlds” they increasingly came into military conflict as well. Encounters starting in Europe, Africa, Asia or the Americas quickly escalated into international global warfare. The Castillo de San Marcos, though a remote outpost, weathered many attacks during these almost incessant colonial wars.
photo.tags: usa florida fl staugustine 2012 castillodesanmarcos saintaugustine
photo.title: Saint Augustine, Florida -- Castillo de San Marcos

photo.description: Photographer at the Castillo.
photo.tags: usa florida fl staugustine 2012 castillodesanmarcos saintaugustine
photo.title: Saint Augustine, Florida -- Castillo de San Marcos

photo.description: Originating in Italy in the 15th century the particular star shaped design of the Castillo is a result of architecture adapting to technology. The change in warfare brought about by black powder weapons created new types of defensive structures adapted both to withstand or avoid the impact of cannon projectiles and to effectively mount cannons to repel any attackers. Of the major architectural variations the &quot;bastion system,&quot; named for the projecting diamond or angle shaped formations added onto the fort walls, was the most commonly and effectively used.
photo.tags: usa florida fl staugustine 2012 castillodesanmarcos saintaugustine
photo.title: Saint Augustine, Florida -- Castillo de San Marcos

photo.title: Castillo de San Marcos - Panorama.

photo.description: Given its light and porous nature, coquina would seem to be a poor choice of building material for a fort. However the Spanish had few other options; it was the only stone available on the northeast coast of La Florida. However, coquina's porosity turned out to have an unexpected benefit. Because of its conglomerate mixture coquina contains millions of microscopic air pockets making it compressible. A cannon ball fired at more solid material, such as granite or brick would shatter the wall into flying shards, but cannon balls fired at the walls of the Castillo burrowed their way into the rock and stuck there, much like a bb would if fired into Styrofoam. So the thick coquina walls absorbed or deflected projectiles rather than yielding to them, providing a surprisingly long-lived fortress.

photo.description: I tried to do my first KAP (Kite Aerial Photography) session in the USA on St. Augustine, FL. The target was the &quot;Castillo de San Marcos&quot;. On that day I had only my small kite (for strong winds). At the beginning, there was almost no wind, but I kept trying. After several tries, I finally managed to get the camera in the air... and right after that I could see lightning rapidly approaching! The wind was getting stronger, hindering me to bring down the kite. Later I found out there was a <b>tornado warning<b> on the radio (what a day to start my KAP here!) I took only a dozen of pictures before I managed to bring down the kite. I collected the camera and part of the equipment moments before the rain started to pour down. You can see the dark, ominous sky in the last picture of this set. ---------------------------------------------------------------------- Tentei fazer minha primeira sessão de fotos aéreas dos EUA em Saint Augustine, na Flórida. O alvo era o &quot;Castillo de San Marcos&quot;. Nesse dia levei comigo uma pipa pequena, para ventos fortes. No início, o vento estava muito fraco. Após várias tentativas e quase desistindo, finalmente o vento apareceu e consegui colocar a câmera no ar... para em seguida ver os relâmpagos de uma tempestade se aproximando rapidamente! O vento só aumentava, atrasando e dificultando o trabalho de descer o equipamento. Mais tarde descobri que foi emitido um <b>alerta de tornado<b> pelo rádio (que dia eu fui escolher para soltar pipa)! Tirei uma dúzia de fotos antes de conseguir recolher a pipa. Guardei a câmera e parte do equipamento momentos antes da chuva desabar. Aúltima foto da série mostra como o céu estava escuro e ameaçador.
photo.tags: usa castle unitedstates florida eua castelo fl kap castillo nationalmonument kiteaerialphotography estadosunidos 5mp castillodesanmarcos saintaugustine castillodesanmarcosnationalmonument カイトフォト castelodesãomarcos
photo.title: Under an ominous sky - 02

I took only a dozen of pictures before I managed to bring down the kite. I collected the camera and part of the equipment moments before the rain started to pour down. You can see the dark, ominous sky in the last picture of this set. ---------------------------------------------------------------------- Tentei fazer minha primeira sessão de fotos aéreas dos EUA em Saint Augustine, na Flórida. O alvo era o &quot;Castillo de San Marcos&quot;. Nesse dia levei comigo uma pipa pequena, para ventos fortes. No início, o vento estava muito fraco. Após várias tentativas e quase desistindo, finalmente o vento apareceu e consegui colocar a câmera no ar... para em seguida ver os relâmpagos de uma tempestade se aproximando rapidamente! O vento só aumentava, atrasando e dificultando o trabalho de descer o equipamento. Mais tarde descobri que foi emitido um <b>alerta de tornado<b> pelo rádio (que dia eu fui escolher para soltar pipa)! Tirei uma dúzia de fotos antes de conseguir recolher a pipa. Guardei a câmera e parte do equipamento momentos antes da chuva desabar. Aúltima foto da série mostra como o céu estava escuro e ameaçador.
photo.tags: sky usa unitedstates florida ominous céu eua fl kap kiteaerialphotography estadosunidos 5mp saintaugustine ameaçador カイトフォト
photo.title: Under an ominous sky - 05

photo.description: I tried to do my first KAP (Kite Aerial Photography) session in the USA on St. Augustine, FL. The target was the &quot;Castillo de San Marcos&quot;. On that day I had only my small kite (for strong winds). At the beginning, there was almost no wind, but I kept trying. After several tries, I finally managed to get the camera in the air... and right after that I could see lightning rapidly approaching! The wind was getting stronger, hindering me to bring down the kite. Later I found out there was a <b>tornado warning<b> on the radio (what a day to start my KAP here!) I took only a dozen of pictures before I managed to bring down the kite. I collected the camera and part of the equipment moments before the rain started to pour down. You can see the dark, ominous sky in the last picture of this set. ---------------------------------------------------------------------- Tentei fazer minha primeira sessão de fotos aéreas dos EUA em Saint Augustine, na Flórida. O alvo era o &quot;Castillo de San Marcos&quot;. Nesse dia levei comigo uma pipa pequena, para ventos fortes. No início, o vento estava muito fraco. Após várias tentativas e quase desistindo, finalmente o vento apareceu e consegui colocar a câmera no ar... para em seguida ver os relâmpagos de uma tempestade se aproximando rapidamente! O vento só aumentava, atrasando e dificultando o trabalho de descer o equipamento. Mais tarde descobri que foi emitido um <b>alerta de tornado<b> pelo rádio (que dia eu fui escolher para soltar pipa)! Tirei uma dúzia de fotos antes de conseguir recolher a pipa. Guardei a câmera e parte do equipamento momentos antes da chuva desabar. Aúltima foto da série mostra como o céu estava escuro e ameaçador.

photo.title: Under an ominous sky - 01

photo.description: Spent the day with the family in St. Augustine. We walked along the outside of the old fort, Castillos de San Marco, and then walked along the river boat watching and exploring. This turned out to be my favorite shot. It seemed to have a little of all of the elements of my other shots. Will be uploading those into a set called St. Augustine shortly. :)
photo.tags: water river florida staugustine waterway matanzas edtech3652010 2010365 2010365photos
photo.title: 96 - Matanzas River
